title: Spoon, 1994-71-20, 1904
markings: On back on bowl, stamped: lion rampant, date stamp for 1905, "VK" with a crescent above representing JM van Kempen & Sons, indistinct Assay office mark of a woman's face and possibly a C for S.Gravenhage, or D for Rotterdam.
creditline: Museum purchase from the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Funds
description: Large circular bowl with three five-petalled flowers in cut-out circles with two rows of stippling encircling each and connecting flowes in trident form. Bowl indents slightly at join to shaft; shaft plain until interrupted by square form with cut-out inner circle. Shaft continues with fluted sides increasing towards oval handle with blue enamel circle encasing four-leaf clover with engraved stem ending in two blue enamel triangles.

participants.person_name: J.M. van Kempen and Son, Voorschoten

exhibitions.title: Structure of Style:  Dutch Modernism in the Applied Arts 1880-1930 [The]
